definition: to spiral/to circle/to go around/to hover/to orbit

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: Just a few things off the top of my head regarding upgradable bags.
sentences.chinese: 一些关于背包升级的想法一直在我脑海里盘旋。

sentences.english: The auguries of death are fast gathering round his head.
sentences.chinese: 死亡凶兆迅速地在他脑海中盘旋。

sentences.english: The spirit that hovers over the chaos in Genesis 1, that refers to the Holy Spirit.
sentences.chinese: 《创世纪》第一章盘旋在混沌之上的灵，指的是圣灵。

sentences.english: The road weaves through the valley.
Goshawk circled in the mountains on the river surging with the cliffs.
sentences.chinese: 苍鹰在山峦上盘旋，江水随着绝壁激荡。

sentences.english: Her hair was black and long and silken and whirled about as did her body.
sentences.chinese: 她有黑色丝般的长发，和她的身体一样盘旋着。

sentences.english: Swirls of smoke rose through the trees.
sentences.chinese: 树林中升起盘旋的青烟。

sentences.english: The woman's screams tore through the swirling snow.
sentences.chinese: 那个女人的尖叫声撕破盘旋的飞雪。

sentences.english: The female was spiraling in the air with the corpse of the male butterfly attached.
sentences.chinese: 原来是雌性背着雄性的尸体在空中盘旋。

sentences.english: The plane circled the airport before landing.
sentences.chinese: 飞机在着陆之前在机场上空盘旋。

sentences.english: Promises are often like the  butterfly, which disappear after beautiful hover.
sentences.chinese: 承诺常常很像蝴蝶，美丽地盘旋然后不见。

sentences.english: Never wind the packing into a coil in the stuffing box.
sentences.chinese: 绝不能将盘根盘旋成圈绕入填料函中。
他在小型机场上空盘旋。

sentences.english: The eagle spirals up into the sky.
For 75 minutes the plane circled. The final landing was a thriller .
sentences.chinese: 飞机在天空盘旋了七十五分钟，最后的降落惊险万状。

sentences.english: Can be circled and the wooden ladder to the top, look around Pingliang city scenery.
sentences.chinese: 可以木梯盘旋而上至顶层，举目四望平凉城市风光。

definition: to flutter/to dance in the breeze
to float/to hover/also written 漂浮
to flit across/to sweep past/to glance (strike at an angle)
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
